attributes.comment:
I am asking you to please not increase the fees which are proposed by the
USCIS. As an adoptive parent, the expense involved with adopting internationally
is already extremely high without this added hike in price. There are many
children around the world who deserve a home but parents are roadblocked by the
costs involved in the process. Now with the proposed fees going up as much as
66% in some cases, more and more potential adoptive parents will be turned
away because they will not be able to afford such high fees.

I am also asking you to specifically reconsider the expense of obtaining an
adopted child's Certificate of Citizenship. As an adoptive mother of a child from
Korea, we are having to pay to obtain his Certificate of Citizenship. This fee which
is high to begin with at $255 is now proposed to be the outrageous expense of
$460. However, nothing additional is gained from such a steep increase in cost.
Also, it seems unjust that parents who adopt from Korea must pay for their child
to receive a Certificate of Citizenship as opposed to parents adopting from
countries such as Russia, China, the Ukraine, etc... whose children are GIVEN
Certificates of Citizenship. There should not be such an expensive discrepancy.

Thank you for taking the time to read my comments, and I pray you will
reconsider these fee increases.

Sincerely, Erin Parsons
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Aaron Parsons
